name: Laasya Yatham
headerTaglineTwo: I am a passionate CS + Canfield Business

projects.title: Bounding Volume Hierarchy Graphics Visualizer
projects.description: Implemented self-balancing Bounding Volume Hierarchy tree by adapting AVL rotation algorithms to maintain optimal tree depth, efficiently detect collisions, and accelerate rendering in a Swing-based graphics application. Validated correctness with comprehensive testing suite: 32 JUnit test cases and 10,000+ fuzz-tested random geometries. Tools Used: Java, JUnit, Swing

projects.title: P2Prompt
projects.description: Developed TypeScript web client enabling users to compare optimal P2P cross-border transfer routes (on/off chain). Designed device-adaptive UI in Figma, leveraged AI tools (v0, Claude) for front-end development, cut prototyping time by 30%. Reduced transfer costs by ~10% by comparing real-time pricing across fiat and crypto rails using Forex feeds, DEX aggregators (Jupiter), and payment APIs (Coinbase, Gecko). Tools Used: TypeScript, APIs, Solana, Figma

projects.title: pseudo-lang
projects.description: Using React and TypeScript, I collaborated with a team to create an IDE mobile app. I focused on the backend of the application by creating a custom programming language in TypeScript that can perform mathematical operations and track operator precedence. Specific tasks included developing the lexer to tokenize user shell input, building the action syntax tree,  using recursion to implement the parser, and finally rendering the output in the terminal display. Tools Used: TypeScript, JavaScript, Next.js

projects.title: HEB Grocer New Online Deli Shop
projects.description: I developed and designed a prototype to improve HEBâ€™s online deli shop by introducing new interactive features! Highlights include creating designs in Figma, accessible design practice (met 100% of WCAG Level AA Guidelines), using Python scripts to construct a database of product information, working with APIs in Postman, and presenting final project to 40+ team members. Tools Used: Figma, Next.js, React/JS, internal design libraries, Postman, Airtable (Case Study/Demo linked)

projects.title: EduMedia Mobile Application
projects.description: EduMedia is a cross-platform mobile application that connects students, parents, and educators by offering a platform to meet everyone's school-related needs. Communicate with teachers quickly using our live chat feature, browse offered clubs, share club posters to Instagram, view the school calendar, add personal events, post pictures to school/club-wide galleries and so much more! Tools Used: Figma, Reacts/JS, Back4App cloud database system + Parse framework (Case Study/Demo Linked)

projects.title: Central Texas Tourism Recs
projects.description: This is your one stop site for finding fun things to do in Central Texas! You can utilize this application in order to find dining, rich history, wonder in the great outdoors, and so much more! Tools Used: HTML, CSS, PHP, SQL, phpMyAdmin, hMailServer

projects.title: CEB Cryptography Simulator
projects.description: AutumnHacks International Hackathon 1st Place Winner! I built a website to improve cybersecurity education with features including informative posts, encryption tools, and a build your own algorithm page where students can visualize the inner workings of ciphers.

aboutpara: I'm interested in exploring SWE, product management, and tech consulting. With diverse experience as a Network Engineering, Design Technologist, and Support Technician intern, I provide a unique skillset with a well rounded understanding of the development life cycle and the business perspectives behind it. My projects include building an IDE, implementing an efficient bounding volume hierarchy tree, and creating a P2P crypto site that identifies the best cross-border transfer routes, which all reflect my drive to learn and grow my skills outside of formal opportunities. I bring dedication and genuine passion to what I do, striving to make an impact within my organization and community.
